sen.j: 佐々木 盛綱（ささき もりつな）は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Moritsuna SASAKI was a warlord from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.
Moritsuna SASAKI was a Japanese military commander who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、"who lived"を追記しました。
sen.e: Moritsuna SASAKI was a Japanese military commander who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 加地 盛綱とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He was also called Moritsuna Kaji.
He was also called Moritsuna KAJI.
sen.cmt: 苗字は、大文字にて表記するので、"KAJI"に変更しました。
sen.e: He was also called Moritsuna KAJI.

sen.j: 近江国の宇多源氏佐々木氏棟梁である佐々木秀義の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI, Toryo (the head) of Sasaki clan of Uda-Genji (Uda-Gen clan).
He was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI who was the head of the Sasaki clan of Uda-Genji (Uda-Gen clan) in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 「近江国」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。棟梁→the head[作業指示一式の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"3項目目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessary、に従い、変更しました]
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI who was the head of the Sasaki clan of Uda-Genji (Uda-Gen clan) in Omi Province.

sen.j: 幼名は秀綱。
sen.e: His childhood name was Hidetsuna.
His childhood name was Hidetsuna.
His childhood name was Hidetsuna.

sen.j: 源頼朝に伊豆国の流人時代から仕え、その挙兵に従い治承・寿永の乱で活躍。
sen.e: He served MINAMOTO no Yoritomo when he was an exile in Izu Province, and did a good job in Jisho-Juei War, following the army raised by Yoritomo.
Moritsuna who had served MINAMOTO no Yoritomo since he had stayed in Izu Province as an exile followed the army raised by Yoritomo and played an active role in the Jisho-Juei War.
sen.cmt: 簡潔にするため、関係代名詞を使った訳文の変更しました。
sen.e: Moritsuna who had served MINAMOTO no Yoritomo since he had stayed in Izu Province as an exile followed the army raised by Yoritomo and played an active role in the Jisho-Juei War.

sen.j: 備前国児島の藤戸の戦いでは、島に篭もる平行盛を破った。
sen.e: In the Battle of Fujito in Kojima, Bizen Province, he defeated TAIRA no Yukimori who had been stuck in an island.
In the Battle of Fujito in Kojima of Bizen Province, he defeated TAIRA no Yukimori who had confined himself to an island.
sen.cmt: ～に篭もる→confine oneself to ～[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: In the Battle of Fujito in Kojima of Bizen Province, he defeated TAIRA no Yukimori who had confined himself to an island.

sen.j: 能の『藤戸の戦い謡曲「藤戸」』、歌舞伎の『近江源氏先陣館』にも登場する。
sen.e: Moritsuna appears in Yokyoku (a Noh song) "Fujito" which is chanted in Noh play "the Battle of Fujito" and a Kabuki play "Omi-Genji Senjinyakata".
Moritsuna is featured in Yokyoku (a Noh song) "Fujito" which is chanted in a Noh play, "the Battle of Fujito," and a Kabuki play "Omi-Genji Senjinyakata."
sen.cmt: 文尾のピリオドを閉じのダブルクォーテーションの前に移動しました。
sen.e: Moritsuna is featured in Yokyoku (a Noh song) "Fujito" which is chanted in a Noh play, "the Battle of Fujito," and a Kabuki play "Omi-Genji Senjinyakata."

sen.j: 文中の月日は全て旧暦
sen.e: All the dates in the text are written according to the old lunar calendar.
All the dates in the text are indicated according to old lunar calendar.
sen.cmt: 動詞となるのは、「表記する」なので、"written"を"indicate"に変更しました。用語リストを参照し、old lunar calendar の前の"the"は削除しました。
sen.e: All the dates in the text are indicated according to old lunar calendar.

sen.j: 改元の有った年は改元後の元号を記す
sen.e: If an era name is changed in the middle of any given year, the new era name is employed to indicate the year.
An era name after change is used for any year in the middle of which the name of an era has changed.
sen.cmt: 簡潔にするため、仮定法を使わない訳文としました。
sen.e: An era name after change is used for any year in the middle of which the name of an era has changed.

sen.j: 近江国佐々木庄を地盤とする宇多源氏佐々木氏の棟梁である佐々木秀義の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: Moritsuna was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI, Toryo (the leader) of SASAKI clan of UDA-GENJI based on Sasakinosho, Omi Province.
Moritsuna was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI who was the head of the SASAKI clan of UDA-GENJI based at Sasakinosho in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 棟梁→the head[作業指示一式の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"3項目目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessary、に従い、変更しました]～を地盤とする→based at["based on"では意味が異なるので、前置詞を変更しました]
sen.e: Moritsuna was born as the third son of Hideyoshi SASAKI who was the head of the SASAKI clan of UDA-GENJI based at Sasakinosho in Omi Province.

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）の平治の乱で父が従った源義朝の敗北により、一門と共に関東へと落ち延び、渋谷重国の庇護を受ける。
sen.e: Due to the defeat of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo whom his father followed in the Heiji War in 1159, Moritsuna (at that time his name was Hidetsuna) fled to Kanto region with his family and received the patronage of Shigekuni SHIBUYA.

Due to the defeat of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo whom Morituna's father followed in the Heiji War in 1159, Hidetsuna (name of Moritsuna before Genpuku (coming-of-age ceremony)) escaped to the Kanto region with his family and was protected by Shigekuni SHIBUYA.
sen.cmt: "Moritsuna (at that time his name was Hidetsuna)"は、下記にて、「元服して名を盛綱に改める」と記載されているので、"Hidetsuna (name of Moritsuna before Genpuku (coming-of-age ceremony))"の訳文に変更しました。庇護を受ける→be protected[簡潔な表現に変更しました]
sen.e: Due to the defeat of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo whom Morituna's father followed in the Heiji War in 1159, Hidetsuna (name of Moritsuna before Genpuku (coming-of-age ceremony)) escaped to the Kanto region with his family and was protected by Shigekuni SHIBUYA.

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)元年（1166年）、元服して名を盛綱に改めると、16歳で伊豆国に流された義朝の遺児・源頼朝の身辺に仕える事となった。
sen.e: After having a ceremony of Genpuku (coming of age) and changing his name to Moritsuna, he happened to serve MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, bereaved child of Yoshitomo, who was banished to Izu Province at the age of 16.
After having Genpuku and changing the name to Moritsuna, he came to serve MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was a bereaved child of Yoshitomo and had been exiled to Izu Province at the age of 16.
sen.cmt: 「義朝の遺児」も関係代名詞で表記した方が分かりやすいので、変更しました。仕える事となった→assigned to serve[「仕えるよう命じられた」との意味なので、変更しました]
sen.e: After having Genpuku and changing the name to Moritsuna, he came to serve MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was a bereaved child of Yoshitomo and had been exiled to Izu Province at the age of 16.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）8月6日、平氏打倒を決意した頼朝の私室に一人呼ばれ、挙兵の計画を告げられる。
sen.e: On August 6, 1180, he was called into Yoritomo's private room where Yoritomo, who had decided to topple TAIRA clan, told him about a plan to raise an army.
On August 6, 1180, Moritsuna was ordered to come to a private room of Yoritomo who made up his mind to defeat the Taira clan, and was told about a plan to raise an army.
sen.cmt: 関係副詞"where"は必要ないので、削除しました。平氏→the Taira clan[対訳・用語集の表記に従い、表記を変更しました]決意する→make up one's mind["decide"よりも「決意する」の持つ意味に合うので、変更しました]呼ばれる→ordered[盛綱は、頼朝に仕える身であり、「呼ばれる」は「来るように命じられる」の意味となるので、変更しました]
sen.e: On August 6, 1180, Moritsuna was ordered to come to a private room of Yoritomo who made up his mind to defeat the Taira clan, and was told about a plan to raise an army.

sen.j: この時に頼朝は「未だ口外せざるといえも、偏に汝を恃むに依って話す」と述べた。
sen.e: At that moment, Yoritomo said, "I will tell you about my plan because I absolutely trust you, even if it has not been revealed yet."
At that time, Yoritomo said to Moritsuna, "Although I don't tell it to anyone yet, I tell my plan to you because I absolutely trust you."
sen.cmt: 頼朝の述べた「」で括られた部分の訳文を、述べられた順序で訳文することにより、頼朝の盛綱を信頼しているという気持ちが伝わると判断し、変更しました。また、"tell ～ to you"に変更することで、「盛綱にだけ」の意味が強まると判断し、"to you"に変更しました。
sen.e: At that time, Yoritomo said to Moritsuna, "Although I don't tell it to anyone yet, I tell my plan to you because I absolutely trust you."

sen.j: 頼朝は他の家人である工藤茂光、土肥実平、岡崎義実、天野遠景、加藤景廉にも同様の言葉を述べていたが、それでも盛綱は当初から頼朝の信頼が厚かった事が分かる。
sen.e: Yoritomo told the same thing to other retainers such as Shigemitsu KUDO, Sanehira DOI, Yoshizane OKAZAKI, Tokage AMANO, and Kagekado KATO, even so, it was clear that Yoritomo had abusolute trust in Moritsuna from the beginning.

The above episode showed that Moritsuna was very much trusted by Yoritomo from the beginning even though Yoritomo told the same thing to other retainers such as Shigemitsu KUDO, Sanehira DOI, Yoshizane OKAZAKI, Tokage AMANO and Kagekado KATO.
sen.cmt: 文頭のスペースを削除しました。英語として自然な表現に変更しました。
sen.e: The above episode showed that Moritsuna was very much trusted by Yoritomo from the beginning even though Yoritomo told the same thing to other retainers such as Shigemitsu KUDO, Sanehira DOI, Yoshizane OKAZAKI, Tokage AMANO and Kagekado KATO.

sen.j: 8月17日の挙兵の日、兄達が山木兼隆の後見で勇士とされた堤信遠を討った後、景廉と共に兼隆の邸宅へと赴きその首を獲った。
sen.e: On the day of raising an army in August 17, after his brothers killed Nobuto TSUTSUMI, who was said to be a brave warrior, and a gurdian of Kanetaka YAMAKI, Moritsuna intruded into the residence of Kanetaka with Kagekado, and beheaded him.

On August 17, 1180, the day of raising an army, Moritsuna's older brothers killed Nobuto TSUTSUMI who was considered to act as guardian of Kanetaka YAMAKI and a brave warrior, and then, Moritsuna went to Kanetaka's residence with Kagekado and cut off his head.
sen.cmt: 前から訳し下げて、時間的な流れを示すため、「後」を "after" の代わりに、"and then"としました。用語リストの指示に従い、「年」を追記しました。兄達→Moritsuna's old brothers[用語リストの指示に従い、"old"を表記しました]"guardian"のミススペルを訂正しました。
sen.e: On August 17, 1180, the day of raising an army, Moritsuna's older brothers killed Nobuto TSUTSUMI who was considered to act as guardian of Kanetaka YAMAKI and a brave warrior, and then, Moritsuna went to Kanetaka's residence with Kagekado and cut off his head.

sen.j: 20日、頼朝に従い相模国へと赴くが石橋山の戦いで敗れる。
sen.e: Although he accompanied Yoritomo to Sagami Provinve on August 20, Yoritomo's army was defeated in the Battle of Ishibashiyama.
Although he accompanied Yoritomo to Sagami Province on August 20, 1180, Yoritomo's army was defeated in the Battle of Ishibashiyama.
sen.cmt: "Province"のミススペルを訂正しました。用語リストの指示従い、「年・月」を追記しました。
sen.e: Although he accompanied Yoritomo to Sagami Province on August 20, 1180, Yoritomo's army was defeated in the Battle of Ishibashiyama.

sen.j: 盛綱兄弟は石橋山で平氏側であった渋谷重国の館に逃れ、重国は喜んで盛綱らを迎え倉庫に隠しもてなした。
sen.e: Moritsuna and his brother fleed to the residence of Shigekuni SHIBUYA, who had been a retainer of TAIRA clan, where Shigekuni willingly welcomed them and provided them with a warehouse to hide.

When Moritsuna and his old brothers fled to the residence of Shigekuni SHIBUYA who had taken the side of the Taira clan in the Battle of Ishibashiyama, Shigekuni welcomed them, sheltered them in a warehouse and offered hospitality.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語にするため、「盛綱兄弟が～の館に逃れこんだ時」の訳文に変更しました。"flee"の過去形"fled"のミススペルを訂正しました。平氏→the Taira clan[対訳・用語集の表記に従い、変更しました]盛綱兄弟→Moritsuna and his old brothers[上記にて、「兄達」と記載されているので、old brothers としました]石橋山→the Battle of Ishibadhiyama[訳が抜けていたので、「石橋山の戦い」として補いました]
sen.e: When Moritsuna and his old brothers fled to the residence of Shigekuni SHIBUYA who had taken the side of the Taira clan in the Battle of Ishibashiyama, Shigekuni welcomed them, sheltered them in a warehouse and offered hospitality.

sen.j: 安房へ逃れていた頼朝が再び兵を集め鎌倉に入ると、盛綱兄弟は再び頼朝の下に参じた。
sen.e: When Yoritomo, who had fleed to Awa Provinve, gatehred soldiers and went into Kamakura, Moritsuna and his brother rushed to Yoritomo, then defeated TAIRA clan in the Battle of Fujigawa in October 20, so in the first grant of honors after the raising of army made in Sagami Provincial office on October 23, Moritsuna was approved as the landowner of a former territory Sasakisho.
When Yoritomo who had fled to Awa Province rose a force of soldiers again and entered Kamakura, Moritsuna and his old brothers rushed to Yoritomo again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処2ヶ所「再び」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。"Province"のミススペルを訂正しました。
sen.e: When Yoritomo who had fled to Awa Province rose a force of soldiers again and entered Kamakura, Moritsuna and his old brothers rushed to Yoritomo again.

sen.j: 10月20日の富士川の戦いで平氏を破り、23日に相模国国府で行われた挙兵後初の論功行賞では、旧領の佐々木庄を安堵された。
sen.e: Moritsuna and his old brothers defeated the Taira clan in the Battle of Fujigawa on October 20, 1180, and were granted a former territory of Sasakinosho in the grant of honors held on August 23, 1180 at the provincial capital of Sagami Province for the first time after the raising of army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処用語リストの指示従い、各日付に「年」を追記しました。平氏→the Taira clan[対訳・用語集の表記に従い、変更しました]相模国国府→the provincial capital of Sagami Province[用語集を参照し、変更しました]佐々木庄→Sasakinosho[対訳の表記に従い、変更しました]
sen.e: Moritsuna and his old brothers defeated the Taira clan in the Battle of Fujigawa on October 20, 1180, and were granted a former territory of Sasakinosho in the grant of honors held on August 23, 1180 at the provincial capital of Sagami Province for the first time after the raising of army.

sen.j: 11月4日、常陸国府での佐竹秀義との戦いにも加わる。
sen.e: On November 4, he also participated in a battle with Hideyoshi SATAKE in the local government of Hitachi.
On November 4, 1180, Moritsuna also participated in a battle with Hideyoshi SATAKE caused at the provincial capital of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 常陸国府→the provincial capital of Hitachi Province[用語集を参照し、変更しました]用語リストの指示に従い、「年」を追記しました。
sen.e: On November 4, 1180, Moritsuna also participated in a battle with Hideyoshi SATAKE caused at the provincial capital of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 寿永元年（1182年）6月7日、由比々浜での酒宴で、酒に酔い倒れた加藤景廉の介抱を行う。
sen.e: He took care of drunken and collapsed Kagekado KATO at a drinking party in Yuigahama on June 7, 1182.
On June 7, 1182, he took care of Kagekado KATO who got falling-down drunk at a drinking party at Yuigahama.
sen.cmt: 酒に酔い倒れた→get falling-down drunk[Eijiro より]
sen.e: On June 7, 1182, he took care of Kagekado KATO who got falling-down drunk at a drinking party at Yuigahama.

sen.j: 10月17日、頼朝の嫡子である源頼家が産所から邸宅に入る際の輿を担いでいる。
sen.e: On October 17, Moritsuna carried Koshi (a palanquin) in which Yoritomo's legitimate child MINAMOTO no Yoriie was being moved from Ubuya (a hut for delibering babies) to his residence.
On October 17, 1182, Moritsuna became one of palanquin bearers when MINAMOTO no Yoriie, Yoritomo's legitimate son, moved from ubuya (a hut for delivering babies) to a residence on the palanquin.
sen.cmt: 用語リストの指示従い、日付に「年」を追記しました。"delivering"のミススペルを訂正しました。嫡子→legitimate son[「嫡男」の意味なので、"son"に変更しました]輿を担ぐ→one of palanquin bearers[一人では、輿を担げないので、"one of palanquin bearers"としました]
sen.e: On October 17, 1182, Moritsuna became one of palanquin bearers when MINAMOTO no Yoriie, Yoritomo's legitimate son, moved from ubuya (a hut for delivering babies) to a residence on the palanquin.

sen.j: 元暦元年（1184年）12月、盛綱は平氏追討の為備前国児島に在り、7日には平行盛が率いる五百余騎が篭もる城を攻め落とす。
sen.e: In December 1184, Moritsuna was in Kojima, Bizen Province to search and kill TAIRA clan, and captured a castle in which more than 500 horse soldiers led by TAIRA no Yukimori had been retreated.

In December 1184, Moritsuna was in Kojima of Bizen Province to search and kill the Taira clan, and on December 7, 1184, he captured a castle which was held by more than 500 horse soldiers led by TAIRA no Yukimori.
sen.cmt: 平氏→the Taira clan[用語集を参照し、変更しました]7日→December 7, 1184[用語リストの指示に従い、年・月を追記しました]～が篭もる城→castle held by ～[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: In December 1184, Moritsuna was in Kojima of Bizen Province to search and kill the Taira clan, and on December 7, 1184, he captured a castle which was held by more than 500 horse soldiers led by TAIRA no Yukimori.

sen.j: この合戦は藤戸合戦と呼ばれ、『平家物語』にも描かれており、島に篭もる行盛に対し、漁師から馬でも渡れる浅瀬を聞き出した盛綱が、波を馬で乗り越え先陣を切って攻め入ったとされる。
sen.e: The battle called Fujito kassen (the battle of Fujito) is featured also in "Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)" where Moritsuna, who got an information from a fisherman about a ford which was shallow enough to cross by riding a horse, then took the lead in invading the island in which Yukimori retreated by crossing the shallow water on a horse.

The battle called the Battle of Fujito was also described in the "Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)," and according to the Heike Monogatari, Moritsuna, who got information from a fisherman about a ford which was shallow enough for horses to cross, rode across the sea by cutting through the waves and took the lead in invading an island to which Yukimori confined himself.
sen.cmt: 藤戸合戦→the Battle of Fujito[用語集を参照し、変更しました]"information"は、不可算名詞なので、"a"を削除しました。波を馬で乗り越え→rode across the sea by cutting through the waves[「波を乗り越えて海を馬で渡る」との意味なので、変更しました]～とされる→according to the Heike Monogatari, ～[Wikipedia 「藤戸合戦」を検索し、「漁師から馬でも渡れる浅瀬を聞き出した盛綱が、波を馬で乗り越え先陣を切って攻め入った」との記述は、平家物語にのみ見られるので、訳文を変更しました]
sen.e: The battle called the Battle of Fujito was also described in the "Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)," and according to the Heike Monogatari, Moritsuna, who got information from a fisherman about a ford which was shallow enough for horses to cross, rode across the sea by cutting through the waves and took the lead in invading an island to which Yukimori confined himself.

sen.j: なお地元ではその漁師を口封じの為に殺したと伝わる。
sen.e: It is known to the local people that Moritsuna killed the fisherman to keep his mouth shut.
In addition, it is told among the local people that Moritsuna killed the fisherman to keep his mouth shut.
sen.cmt: なお→in addition[用語リストの指示に従い、追記しました]伝わる→be told[話が伝えられているので、"told"としました]
sen.e: In addition, it is told among the local people that Moritsuna killed the fisherman to keep his mouth shut.

tit.e: Shogunal retainers (of the Kamakura bakufu) in Kamakura
tit.cmt: 対訳・用語集を参照し、変更しました。
tit.e: Shogunal retainers (of the Kamakura bakufu) in Kamakura

sen.j: 平家滅亡後、源頼朝と弟の源義経との間で対立が深まっており、そうした中の文治元年（1185年）10月24日、頼朝は父である源義朝の供養を行い、盛綱もそれに列している。
sen.e: In the middle of deepened confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and his younger brother MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune after the fall of the TAIRA clan, Yoritomo conducted a memorial serveice for his father MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, which Moritsuna was also attended.

Under circumstances where a confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, got more serious after the fall of the TAIRA clan, Yoritomo held a memorial service for his father, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, on October 24, 1185, and Moritsuna also attended it.
sen.cmt: そうした中→under circumstances where[「平家滅亡後、源頼朝と弟の源義経との間で対立が深まっている中」との意味なので、訳文を変更しました]文治元年（1185年）10月24日→October 24, 1185[訳が抜けていたので、補いました]供養を行う→hold a memorial service[用語集を参照し、変更しました]"between"の後のスペースを一つ削除し、"younger brother"の後にカンマを付けました。
sen.e: Under circumstances where a confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, got more serious after the fall of the TAIRA clan, Yoritomo held a memorial service for his father, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, on October 24, 1185, and Moritsuna also attended it.

sen.j: 文治2年（1185年）10月24日、甘縄神社へ参拝した頼朝に随行する。
sen.e: When Yoritomo visited Amanawa-jinja Shrine on October 24, 1185, Moritsuna accompanied him.
On October 24, 1186, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Amanawa-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 文治2年（1185年）10月24日→October 24, 1186[原文では、文治2年（1185年）と記載されておりますが、上記にて文治元年を（1185年）記載しており、また、用語集を参照し、1186に変更しました]以降、時系列的に出来事を列記しているので、日付が重要な要素と解釈し、日付を文頭に置きました。
sen.e: On October 24, 1186, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Amanawa-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 文治4年（1187年）7月10日、源頼家が初めて鎧を着る儀式に加わる。
sen.e: He attended a ceremony where Yoriie first got dressed in armor on July 10, 1187.
On July 10, 1188, he joined a ceremony of MINAMOTO no Yoriie's first wearing armor.
sen.cmt: 文治4年（1187年）7月10日→July 10, 1188[原文では、文治4年（1187年）と記載されておりますが、上記にて文治元年を（1185年）記載しており、また、用語集を参照し、1188に変更しました]源頼家が初めて鎧を着る儀式→ceremony of MINAMOTO no Yoriie's first wearing armor[初訳のceremony in which Yoriie first got dressed in armor では、「頼家が初めて鎧を着た儀式」となり、意味が異なるので、訳文を変更しました]時系列的に出来事を列記しているので、日付を文頭に置きました。
sen.e: On July 10, 1188, he joined a ceremony of MINAMOTO no Yoriie's first wearing armor.

sen.j: 建久元年（1190年）8月15日、頼朝の鶴岡八幡宮参拝に随行する。
sen.e: When Yoritomo visited Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine on August 15, 1185, Moritsuna accompanied him.
On August 15, 1190, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 建久元年（1190年）8月15日→August 15, 1190[誤記を、訂正しました]時系列的に出来事を列記しているので、日付を文頭に置きました。
sen.e: On August 15, 1190, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine.

sen.j: 同年7月20日、頼朝の邸宅での双六の最中に、盛綱の15歳の息子・加地信実が工藤祐経の額を石で打ち、流血へと至る事件が起きる。
sen.e: On July 20 in the same year, an incident happened in which Nobuzane KAJI, the 15-year old son of Moritsuna hit Suketsune KUDO on the forehead with a stone while they were palying a game of Sugoroku at Yoritomo's residence, ending up a bloody affairs.

On July 20 of the same year, there occurred an incident that Nobuzane KAJI, 15-year-old son of Moritsuna, hit Suketsune KUDO on the forehead with a stone while they were palying a game of Sugoroku at Yoritomo's residence, and Suketsune got bleeding.
sen.cmt: 同年→of the same year[前置詞を訂正しました]15歳の息子→15-year-old son["old"の前にハイフンを付けました]
sen.e: On July 20 of the same year, there occurred an incident that Nobuzane KAJI, 15-year-old son of Moritsuna, hit Suketsune KUDO on the forehead with a stone while they were palying a game of Sugoroku at Yoritomo's residence, and Suketsune got bleeding.

sen.j: 信実はその場を逃れ、盛綱はその後を追ったが、翌日に頼朝より信実を捕らえよと命じられる。
sen.e: Moritsuna chased Nobuzane who had left the site, then he was ordered to capture Nobuzane on the following day.
Although he chased Nobuzane who escaped from there, Moritsuna was ordered by Yoritomo to capture Nobuzane on the following day.
sen.cmt: 文頭のスペースを削除しました。「頼朝より」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。
sen.e: Although he chased Nobuzane who escaped from there, Moritsuna was ordered by Yoritomo to capture Nobuzane on the following day.

sen.j: しかし盛綱は、信実は既に出家を遂げ逃亡し、親子の縁を切ったと述べる。
sen.e: However, Moritsuna said that as Nobutsune had already run away and become a priest, Moritsuna had severed parent-child relationship with him.
However, Moritsuna said that he disowned his son, Nobuzane, because Nobuzane had already run away and become a priest.
sen.cmt: 親子の縁を切る→disown his son[Eijiro では、"disown one's child"とありますが、信実は、息子なので、"disown his son"としました]英語の自然な表現とするため、結論、理由の順に訳文を変更しました。
sen.e: However, Moritsuna said that he disowned his son, Nobuzane, because Nobuzane had already run away and become a priest.

sen.j: 頼朝が盛綱に対し、祐経に対する謝罪を命じると、既に親子の縁を切った事を理由に謝罪を拒否した。
sen.e: When Yoritomo ordered Moritsuna to apologize to Suketsune, Moritsuna refused to do so because he had already endedn his relationship with Nobuzane.
When Yoritomo ordered Moritsuna to apologize to Suketsune, Moritsuna refused to apologize on the grounds that he had already disowned his son.
sen.cmt: ～を理由に→on the grounds that ～[より的確な訳文とするため、変更しました]
sen.e: When Yoritomo ordered Moritsuna to apologize to Suketsune, Moritsuna refused to apologize on the grounds that he had already disowned his son.

sen.j: 9月から11月、頼朝に従い上洛し、院への参上や石清水八幡宮への参拝などに随行する。
sen.e: From September to November, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo to go to Kyoto to pay homage to the Imperial Court and visit Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine and so on.
From September to November 1190, Moritsuna who accompanied Yoritomo on his going to Kyoto also accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to the Imperial Palace, to Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, and so on.
sen.cmt: 9月から11月→From September to November 1190[用語リストの指示に従い、「年」を追記しました]院への参上→visit to the Imperial Palace[「参内」と解釈し、用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: From September to November 1190, Moritsuna who accompanied Yoritomo on his going to Kyoto also accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to the Imperial Palace, to Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, and so on.

sen.j: 建久2年（1191年）10月1日、奥州と越後国よりウシ15頭を頼朝に贈る。
sen.e: In October 1, 1191, Moritsuna presented 15 cows produced in Oshu (nothern Honsyu) and Echigo Province to Yoritomo.
On October 1, 1191, Moritsuna presented 15 cows produced in Oshu (Mutsu Province) and Echigo Province to Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 日付の場合は、"on"となるので、"In October 1, 1191"を "On October 1, 1191"に訂正しました。奥州→Oshu (Mutsu Province)[「越後国」の記述もあるので、変更しました]
sen.e: On October 1, 1191, Moritsuna presented 15 cows produced in Oshu (Mutsu Province) and Echigo Province to Yoritomo.

sen.j: 建久3年（1192年）11月15日、永福寺跡への参拝に随行する。
sen.e: He accompanied Yoritomo to visit Eifuku-ji Temple Ruins on November 15, 1192.
On November 15, 1192, he accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Eifuku-ji Temple Ruins.
sen.cmt: 日付が重要な要素と解釈し、日付を文頭に置きました。
sen.e: On November 15, 1192, he accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Eifuku-ji Temple Ruins.

sen.j: 建久4年（1193年）9月7日には後白河天皇の崩御後に荒廃していた御所の宿直を命じられる。
sen.e: On September 7, 1193, Moritsuna was assigned to Tonoi (a guard) of the Imperial Palace which was devastated after the death of Emperor Goshirakawa.
On September 7, 1193, Moritsuna was appointed to Tonoi (guard) of the Imperial Palace which had been devastated after the death of the Emperor Goshirakawa.
sen.cmt: 「荒廃していた」のは、「命じられる」よりも前のことなので、"had been devastated"に変更しました。
sen.e: On September 7, 1193, Moritsuna was appointed to Tonoi (guard) of the Imperial Palace which had been devastated after the death of the Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 建久5年（1194年）2月2日、北条泰時の元服式に、11月21日には三島大社の神事による笠懸に加わる。
sen.e: He attended Yasutoki HOJO's Genpuku (coming of age) ceremony on February 2, 1194, and participated in a Shinto ritual of Kasagake at Mishima -taisha Shrine on Novemeber 21.

On February 2, 1194, he attended a genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony for Yasutoki HOJO, and on November 21 of the same year, he participated in kasagake (horseback archery competition) held as one of Shinto rituals at Mishima-taisha Shrine.
sen.cmt: 元服式→genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony[用語集を参照し、変更しました]11月21日→November 21, 1194[用語リストの指示に従い「年」を追記する代わりに、「同年」を追記しました]三島大社→Mishima-taisha Shrine["Mishima"の後のスペースを削除しました]笠懸→kasagake (hoseback archery competition)[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: On February 2, 1194, he attended a genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony for Yasutoki HOJO, and on November 21 of the same year, he participated in kasagake (horseback archery competition) held as one of Shinto rituals at Mishima-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 建久6年（1195年）4月10日、東大寺供養の為に上洛した頼朝の参内に従い、この時には兵衛尉に任じられている。
sen.e: On April 10, 1195, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on a visit to the Imperial Palace in Kyoto to make offerings to Todai-ji Temple, where he was appointed as Hyoe no jo (Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards).

On April 10, 1195, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to the Imperial Palace when Yoritomo came to Kyoto for memorial service for Todai-ji Temple, and he was appointed as Hyoe no jo (Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards) at this time.
sen.cmt: 初訳では、「東大寺供養のために参内する」の意味となり、原文と意味が異なるので、変更しました。東大寺供養→memorial service for Todai-ji Temple[用語集の「興福寺供養」の表記"Kofuku-ji kuyo (memorial service for Kofuku-ji Temple)"を参照し、作業指示一式の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"第3項目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessary、に従い、変更しました]上洛する→come to Kyoto[この時、盛綱は既に京にいるので、盛綱から見ると"come to Kyoto"になるので、変更しました]
sen.e: On April 10, 1195, Moritsuna accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to the Imperial Palace when Yoritomo came to Kyoto for memorial service for Todai-ji Temple, and he was appointed as Hyoe no jo (Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards) at this time.

sen.j: 5月20日の天王寺参拝にも随行している。
sen.e: He also accompanied Yoritomo on a visit to Tenno-ji Temple on May 20.
On May 20, 1195, he also accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Tenno-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 用語リストの指示に従い、「年」を追記しました。
sen.e: On May 20, 1195, he also accompanied Yoritomo on his visit to Tenno-ji Temple.

sen.j: 頼朝が没した後の建久10年（1199年）3月22日には、出家しており西念と称する。
sen.e: After Yoritomo passed away, Moritsuna entered into priesthood on March 22, 1199, and he was called Sainen.
On March 22, 1199 after Yoritomo died, Moritsuna had already entered into priesthood, and called himself Sainen.
sen.cmt: 出家しており→had already entered into priesthood[「既に出家している」の意味なので、変更しました]～と称する→call oneself ～[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: On March 22, 1199 after Yoritomo died, Moritsuna had already entered into priesthood, and called himself Sainen.

sen.j: 建仁元年（1201年）4月3日、上野国磯部郷に在り、城資盛・坂額御前の反乱の制圧を命じられる。
sen.e: On April 3, 1201, Moritsuna was in Isobe-go, Kozuke Province where he was ordered to subdue a rebellion raised by Sukemori JO and Hangaku Gozen.
On April 3, 1201, Sainen who was in Isobe-go of Kozuke Province was ordered to subdue a rebellion raised by Sukemori JO and Hangaku Gozen.
sen.cmt: 「上野国磯辺郷にいた西念（すでに西念と称しているので）に命令が下る」との意味なので、関係代名詞を使った訳文の変更しました。
sen.e: On April 3, 1201, Sainen who was in Isobe-go of Kozuke Province was ordered to subdue a rebellion raised by Sukemori JO and Hangaku Gozen.

sen.j: 命令は4月5日に西念の下に届き、越後国鳥坂城に構える城資盛を激戦の末に破った（建仁の乱）。
sen.e: After receiving the order on April 5, Sainen (Moritsuna) defeated Sukemori JO who had settled down in Tossaka-jo Castle in Echigo Province, after a fierce battle (Kennin War)
After receiving the order on April 5, 1201, Sainen fought a fierce battle with Sukemori JO who stood ready to fight at Tossaka-jo Castle in Echigo Province, before defeating him (Kennin War).
sen.cmt: 上記にて、盛綱が既に出家し、西念と称していることが述べられているので、(Moritsuna)は削除しました。用語リストの指示に従い、「年」を補いました。構える→be ready to fight[「戦う準備ができている」の意味なので、変更しました]「激戦の末に破った」は、「戦う準備ができている城資盛と激戦し、破った（破る前に激戦した）」の訳文の方が、より自然な表現になると判断し、変更しました。文尾にピリオドを付けました。
sen.e: After receiving the order on April 5, 1201, Sainen fought a fierce battle with Sukemori JO who stood ready to fight at Tossaka-jo Castle in Echigo Province, before defeating him (Kennin War).

sen.j: 牧氏事件では、元久2年（1205年）閏7月26日京に在った朝雅を討つ軍に加わる。
sen.e: In Makishi Incident, he joined the army to defeat Tomomasa, who had been in Kyoto on July 26, 1205.
In the Makishi Incident, he joined the army to defeat Tomomasa who was in Kyoto, on leap July 26, 1205.
sen.cmt: 牧氏事件では→In the Makishi Incident[用語集を参照し、定冠詞を付けました]閏→leap[訳が抜けていたので、補いました]
sen.e: In the Makishi Incident, he joined the army to defeat Tomomasa who was in Kyoto, on leap July 26, 1205.

sen.j: 没年月日は不詳であるが、倉敷市に盛綱のものと伝わる墓が残っている。
sen.e: Although the date of Moritsuna's death is unknown, a grave which is considered to be Morituna's remains in Kurashiki City.
Although the date of Moritsuna's death is unknown, there remains a grave in Kurashiki City, where, it is told, Moritsuna was buried.
sen.cmt: 「盛綱のものと伝わる墓」は、「盛綱が埋葬されていると伝わる墓」の意味なので、原文通りではなく、意味を汲み取り訳文を変更しました。
sen.e: Although the date of Moritsuna's death is unknown, there remains a grave in Kurashiki City, where, it is told, Moritsuna was buried.
